title: ABii Opens Ashiaman, Aflao Branches
text:
20 July 2015 17:33 CET ABii Opens Ashiaman, Aflao Branches By Daily Guide Abii National 
As part of efforts to offer quality services to its cherished customers across the country, ABii National Savings & Loans Limited, a member of the Tobinco Group of Companies, has opened two new branches at Ashiaman and Aflao. 
This brings to 11, the total number of offices opened by ABii in less than two years of operation. 
The move directly falls in line with the company's corporate strategic goal of enlarging the customer base and helping more people to enjoy ABii's unique products. 
It would help the bank to offer convenient, reliable and pleasant banking services to many individuals and businesses across the country. 
ABii National, with the motto, ' True SME Partner ' has indicated its preparedness to build strong and viable business partnerships. 
'With trading being the main occupation of the people within the Ashiaman and Aflao areas, our product lines and operational efficiencies will perfectly suit the personal and business activities of citizens, and we will sturdily grow these businesses to become giant ventures within a few months and years,' Managing Director of the company, Godfried Osei-Boakye said in a short interview after the opening of the branches. 
He also added that ABii National considers customer satisfaction as critical to its activities, adding that they have developed numerous Customer Service initiatives to ensure that customers' needs and expectations are met within the shortest possible time. 
The Head of Finance and Operations at ABii National, Noah Otuteye, said 17,418 accounts were opened while total deposits and loans granted were GH¢47.80 million and GH¢28.90 million respectively. 
ABii National, which intends to become the most desired indigenous bank, is looking forward to offering unbeatable services to people in various parts of the country.
